column4: Hello! I installed ubuntu successfully from http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/download-wubi. Unfortunately, it set up a dual-boot situation, which defaults to windows. What's the best way to make this default to ubuntu (and/or remove windows)?
since wubi is a windows installer, you'd not do well to remove windows.  Editing grub for boot sequence can be done however.  If you don't want windows you should do a normal install, not with wubi.
Myrtti, Jeruvy: Are you saying I don't actually have a true version of Ubuntu? I only used wubi because I have no access to any kind of CD burner.
wubi installs in a virtual disk inside your windows environment.
